name: DonkeyEntityHelper
description: The `DonkeyEntityHelper` class provides specialized access to donkey entities in Minecraft. Donkeys are passive mobs that can be tamed, ridden, and equipped with chests for storage. This helper extends the functionality of AbstractHorseEntityHelper with donkey-specific features, making it ideal for scripts that manage donkey companions, track storage capabilities, or coordinate donkey-based transportation systems.
overview: This helper is particularly useful for creating scripts that manage donkey inventories, analyze donkey performance statistics, coordinate mounted transport with storage, or track the status of tameable donkey entities in the world. Donkeys serve as excellent pack animals due to their ability to carry chests while maintaining the mobility of horses.

methods.name: hasChest
methods.description: `true` if the donkey is carrying a chest, `false` otherwise. This method checks whether the donkey currently has a chest equipped. Donkeys with chests have increased inventory capacity (typically 15 slots for storage plus the saddle slot), making them valuable pack animals for long expeditions or resource gathering operations.

methods.name: getOwner
methods.description: The UUID of this donkey's owner as a string, or `null` if it has no owner.

methods.name: isTame
methods.description: `true` if this donkey is already tamed, `false` otherwise.

methods.name: isAngry
methods.description: `true` if this donkey is angry, `false` otherwise.

methods.name: isSaddled
methods.description: `true` if this donkey is saddled, `false` otherwise.

methods.name: canWearArmor
methods.description: `true` if this donkey can wear armor, `false` otherwise.

methods.name: canBeSaddled
methods.description: `true` if this donkey can be saddled, `false` otherwise.

methods.name: getInventorySize
methods.description: This donkey's inventory size. Donkeys typically have 2 slots without a chest (saddle + armor) and 16 slots with a chest equipped (1 saddle + 15 storage). Donkeys cannot wear armor, so without a chest they only have 1 slot for the saddle.

methods.name: isBred
methods.description: `true` if this donkey was bred and not naturally spawned, `false` otherwise.

methods.name: isEating
methods.description: `true` if this donkey is currently eating grass, `false` otherwise.

methods.name: getJumpStrengthStat
methods.description: This donkey's jump strength attribute value.
examples:
const jumpStrength = donkey.getJumpStrengthStat();
Chat.log(`Jump strength: ${jumpStrength.toFixed(3)}`);

methods.name: getHorseJumpHeight
methods.description: This donkey's maximum jump height for its current jump strength. The result is only an approximation but is very close to actual Minecraft behavior.
examples:
const jumpHeight = donkey.getHorseJumpHeight();
Chat.log(`Maximum jump height: ${jumpHeight.toFixed(2)} blocks`);

methods.name: getMaxJumpStrengthStat
methods.description: The maximum possible value of a donkey's jump strength (always returns 1).
examples:
const maxJump = donkey.getMaxJumpStrengthStat();
Chat.log(`Maximum possible jump strength: ${maxJump}`);

methods.name: getMinJumpStrengthStat
methods.description: The minimum possible value of a donkey's jump strength (always returns 0.4).
examples:
const minJump = donkey.getMinJumpStrengthStat();
Chat.log(`Minimum possible jump strength: ${minJump.toFixed(1)}`);

methods.name: getSpeedStat
methods.description: This donkey's speed attribute value.
examples:
const speedStat = donkey.getSpeedStat();
Chat.log(`Speed stat: ${speedStat.toFixed(4)}`);

methods.name: getHorseSpeed
methods.description: This donkey's speed in blocks per second.
examples:
const speed = donkey.getHorseSpeed();
Chat.log(`Movement speed: ${speed.toFixed(2)} blocks per second`);

methods.name: getMaxSpeedStat
methods.description: The maximum possible value of a donkey's speed stat (always returns 0.3375).
examples:
const maxSpeed = donkey.getMaxSpeedStat();
Chat.log(`Maximum possible speed stat: ${maxSpeed.toFixed(4)}`);

methods.name: getMinSpeedStat
methods.description: The minimum possible value of a donkey's speed stat (always returns 0.1125).
examples:
const minSpeed = donkey.getMinSpeedStat();
Chat.log(`Minimum possible speed stat: ${minSpeed.toFixed(4)}`);

methods.name: getHealthStat
methods.description: This donkey's health stat (equal to `getMaxHealth()`).
examples:
const health = donkey.getHealthStat();
Chat.log(`Health: ${health} hearts`);

methods.name: getMaxHealthStat
methods.description: The maximum possible value of a donkey's health stat (always returns 30).
examples:
const maxHealth = donkey.getMaxHealthStat();
Chat.log(`Maximum possible health: ${maxHealth} hearts`);

methods.name: getMinHealthStat
methods.description: The minimum possible value of a donkey's health stat (always returns 15).
examples:
const minHealth = donkey.getMinHealthStat();
Chat.log(`Minimum possible health: ${minHealth} hearts`);
